qas.question: Who is the Museo Soumaya named after?

answers.text: the wife of Mexican magnate Carlos Slim

qas.question: What city houses the only collection of Rodin sculptures that is larger than the one in Mexico City?
What other famous sculpture has had his art displayed at the Museo Soumaya?
When did the new design of the museum open?
How many years worth of art does the Museum in the historic center hold?

context: The Museo Soumaya, named after <a0_0>the wife of Mexican magnate Carlos Slim<a0_0/>, has the largest private collection of original Rodin sculptures outside <a1_0>Paris<a1_0/>. It also has a large collection of <a2_0>Dalí<a2_0/> sculptures, and recently began showing pieces in its masters collection including El Greco, Velázquez, Picasso and Canaletto. The museum inaugurated a new futuristic-design facility in <a3_0>2011<a3_0/> just north of Polanco, while maintaining a smaller facility in Plaza Loreto in southern Mexico City. The Colección Júmex is a contemporary art museum located on the sprawling grounds of the Jumex juice company in the northern industrial suburb of Ecatepec. It is said to have the largest private contemporary art collection in Latin America and hosts pieces from its permanent collection as well as traveling exhibits by leading contemporary artists. The new Museo Júmex in Nuevo Polanco was slated to open in November 2013. The Museo de San Ildefonso, housed in the Antiguo Colegio de San Ildefonso in Mexico City's historic downtown district is a 17th-century colonnaded palace housing an art museum that regularly hosts world-class exhibits of Mexican and international art. Recent exhibits have included those on David LaChapelle, Antony Gormley and Ron Mueck. The National Museum of Art (Museo Nacional de Arte) is also located in a former palace in the historic center. It houses a large collection of pieces by all major Mexican artists of the last <a4_0>400<a4_0/> years and also hosts visiting exhibits.
